bioghist.p: The Charlotte Cushman Club was a club for women actresses in Philadelphia. It was named for Charlotte Cushman, the first woman director of the Walnut Street Theater and an internationally famous Shakespearean actress of the mid-to-late 1800s. The club occupied several buildings over its history, including locations at 12th and Locust, 10th and Spruce, and Camac Street.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains administrative records, scrapbooks, photographic materials, and printed materials related to the club. Materials include: the club's by-laws and charter; meeting minutes; yearly reports; membership nominations, dues, and lists; library and museum records, including inventories; files on the yearly Cushman Award such as photos, schedules, budgets, correspondence; financial records for events and for the physical properties, including ledgers, budget and salary records, bills and receipts, investments, and insurance; correspondence between members and with companies and individual actors; Plays and Players scrapbooks (1899-1933) that include playbills and images from productions in Philadelphia, New York, and other northeastern cities; histories of the club; and a copy of Jean Rapp's manuscript "The Philadelphia Theaters" (1990s). There are also photographs and negatives of actors, productions, and the Club's various houses, as well as newspaper clippings, programs and playbills, scrapbooks of newspaper clippings, scripts, invitations and flyers, the club's seal, and a published biography of Charlotte Cushman.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
